intro: Hymenanthera alpina, commonly known as the alpine honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, adapted to cold and harsh climates. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers that are usually pink or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round structure in its natural habitat. Hymenanthera alpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
